_source.text: [ 12 ] Nintendo Power largely agreed, stating that the game had "[e]xcellent game depth and good graphics for a Game Boy RPG", but found the title's story and gameplay to be too similar to previous Final Fantasy Legend games, warning "don't expect anything new in this game", giving the game a score of 3.35 / 5. [ 13 ] IGN called attention to the game's dated graphics and "imperfect" soundtrack, yet still found the game's music to be better than most Game Boy titles.

_source.text: 2013 marked the release of the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One, and while games like Ryse: Son of Rome and Killzone: Shadow Fall feature amazing sights, nothing shows off the graphical power of gaming better than The Last of Us on PlayStation 3. From beautiful, snow-blanketed forests to gorgeous-yet-gritty urban streets and stunning sun-soaked mountain vistas, The Last of Us gives the sense of vast environments while actually being a fairly contained experience.
